value: A member of the Sudell family, probably Henry Sudell of Ashley House, Box, Wiltshire; probably sold Christie's, London, 27 June 1889, Catalogue of an Old Sèvres Service, Oriental, Dresden & English Porcelain and Decorative Furniture, from Gatton Park, formerly the Property of the Rt Hon. Frederick John Lord Monson . . ., one of eight sauceboats lots 74-77, or from two later sales, Christie's, London, 17 July 1895, lot 118, two saucières; or 23 April 1913, lot 35, two saucières.
Soft-paste porcelain sauce boat, with a bleu nouveau ground, painted with an exotic bird at each end in enamels, and gilded.

Soft-paste porcelain, moulded, decorated with a royal blue (beau bleu) ground, painting in greyish-turquoise, shades of green, yellow, dark pink, mauve, brown, grey, and black enamels, and gilding. Of elongated oval shape with a lip at each end, standing on a footring. In the middle of each side there is a double-entwined handle wth stylised leaves projecting at the top of the handle and leaves in relief at the junctions of the lower ends with the body. There is a suspension hole in the footring. The ground is beau bleu with at each end under the lip a pear-shaped reserve, framed by a wide and a narrow gilt band, and painted in polychrome with an exotic bird standing amid foliage, the Ortolan de Neige at one end and the Perruche de la Caroline at the other. The ground between the reserves is elaborately decorated with chased gold scrolls, stylised plant forms, and swags of flowers and foliage. There are two gilt bands round the foot with a reserved white band between, and a further gilt band a little higher up. There is a gilt band round the rim, sprays of flowers and foliage on the interior of the body at the junctions of the handles, lines of gilding down the sides of the handles and sprays of foliage down their backs. On the base, inscribed in blue enamel above the mark 'L'Ortolan,/de Neige.' and below the mark, 'Perruche/de la/Caroline.'

summary_title: Buffon, Georges Louis Leclerc, comte de

description: soft-paste porcelain. moulded, glazed, and decorated with an overglaze blue ground, reserves painted in greyish-turquoise, shades of green, yellow, dark pink, mauve, brown, grey, and black enamels, and gilding

value: interlaced L's with PP on the left

location: on the base, on the right of the factory mark

summary_title: Catalogue of an Old Sèvres Service, Oriental, Dresden, & English Porcelain and Decorative Furniture, from Gatton Park, formerly the Property of the Rt. Hon. Frederick John Lord Monson . . .
notes: Ref. p. 7, lots 62-88, Service of Old Sèvres Porcelain, Painted with birds in colours, from Buffon's 'Histoire Naturelle des Oiseaux' in borders of gros-bleu, with the arms of the Lancashire family of Sudell, for whom it was made in 1792 (sic); and other rich gilding by Vincent.  Lots 74-77 were each a pair of two-handled sauceboats.

summary_title: Porcelaines de Vincennes, Les Origines de Sèvres
notes: Ref.  p. 98, mention saucière à deux becs appearing in the factory's inventory of January 1756

summary_title: Three Centuries of French Domestic Silver
notes: Cf. vol. 1, p. 227, no. 341, Paris, and p. 304, no. 480, unspecified town, examples of silver sauceboats with two lips and central handles

summary_title: Sèvres Plates and Services of the 18th Century
notes: Ref. vol. IV, pp. 1003-05 for the service made for Sudell. This sauceboat is mentioned on p. 1005. See vol. I, iii for the decorator's mark

summary_title: The Wallace Collection, Catalogue of Sèvres Porcelain
notes: Ref. vol. III, pp. 1002-4 for Edme-François Bouilliat père, and pp. 1045-7, for Etienne-Henry Le Guay ainé père (1719/20-c. 1799, working at the factory 1742-3, 1748-9, and 1751-96.

summary_title: Histoire Naturelle Générale et Particulière avec la Description du Cabinet du Roi, Histoire Naturelle des Oiseaux
notes: Cf. vol. IV, 1778 (vol. XXVI), p. 320 illustrated pl. 497 for the Ortolan de Neige; vol. VI, 1779 (vol. xxviii), p. 2874, illustrated pl. 499 for the Perruche de la Caroline.

summary_title: The Collections of Sir Alfred Beit: 2
notes: Cf. p. 222, fig. 12, a similarly decorated sauceboat of 1758, one of a set of four.

summary_title: Ceramics. 400 Years of British Collecting in 100 Masterpieces
notes: Cf. pp. 146-7, a water jug and basin and an écuelle and stand with bird decoration reserved in a blue ground, made in 1780, in the Sackville Collection on loan to Knole, Kent. The birds were painted by Etienne Evans after plates in the 'Planches enluminées', (Paris 1767-83) accompanying the comte de Buffon's 'Histoire naturelle des oiseaux', Paris, 1770-83.

summary_title: A thing of Beauty is a Joy For Ever. Vincennes and Sèvres Porcelain from a Private Collection
notes: Cf. pp. 204-05, a serving dish (plat ovale) of 1793 from the Sudell service, which has the family's arms in one of the reserves on the border. The author provides information about the factory's records for the service
